author: Arezki Amiri
title: Hidden Volcanoes Beneath Antarctica Threaten Global Disaster as Ice Melts, Scientists Warn
text:
Deep beneath Antarctica’s icy surface lies an ominous secret—a vast network of active volcanoes poised for eruption . As the planet warms, the ice sheet’s protective grip is loosening, potentially igniting a cataclysmic chain reaction that could reshape the continent and accelerate global climate change.
A Volcanic Network Hidden Under Ice Antarctica, often seen as a frozen, lifeless wasteland, is anything but static. The West Antarctic Rift System is a volcanic hotspot, harboring over 100 potentially active volcanoes beneath its ice sheets. While some, like Mount Erebus , visibly remind us of Antarctica’s volcanic nature, the majority lie buried under kilometers of ice, making them difficult to study and even harder to predict.
These volcanoes are not dormant—they are active systems under immense pressure from the weight of the ice. The thick ice suppresses the rise of magma and minimizes volcanic activity, creating a precarious balance between fire and ice.
West Antarctic Rift System. Wiki The Role of Climate Change in Triggering Eruptions This delicate equilibrium is being dismantled by climate change . A recent study published in Geochemistry, Geophysics, Geosystems reveals how the accelerating melting of Antarctic glaciers is setting off a dangerous feedback loop. Here’s how it works:
Melting reduces ice thickness : As the ice melts, the weight pressing down on the Earth’s crust decreases, particularly over volcanic zones. Pressure release destabilizes magma chambers : With less pressure, the magma in these chambers begins to decompress. This triggers the release of trapped gases, creating bubbles that expand and increase internal pressure. Increased pressure causes eruptions : The growing pressure inside magma chambers eventually forces magma upward, resulting in volcanic eruptions beneath the thinning ice sheet. These under-ice eruptions are not minor. They release significant heat, which melts even more ice. The study’s simulations demonstrate that this process is not a one-time event but a self-perpetuating cycle that could last for centuries.
Mount Erebus is one of Antarctica’s many active volcanoes. Josh Landis, U.S. Antarctic Program, public domain From Ice Melt to Volcanic Chaos: A Runaway Reaction What makes this situation particularly alarming is the way volcanic activity amplifies glacial melting, creating a feedback loop :
Volcanic heat melts more ice, exposing the bedrock beneath. This reduces the ice’s insulating effect, allowing magma to rise more easily. Each eruption releases gases like carbon dioxide (CO2) , which contribute to the warming of the atmosphere, accelerating global climate change. As this cycle continues, Antarctica’s ice sheet could become a hub of volcanic instability, with far-reaching consequences for the planet.
A Threat to Global Sea Levels and Ecosystems The melting of Antarctica’s ice sheets already threatens to raise global sea levels by several meters . Volcanic activity compounds this risk by speeding up ice loss in vulnerable areas, particularly West Antarctica. Scientists warn that:
The West Antarctic Ice Sheet, already destabilized, could experience collapse faster than previously predicted. Increased volcanic activity could inject ash and aerosols into the atmosphere, altering global weather patterns and accelerating the warming of the Southern Ocean, which surrounds Antarctica. This volcanic awakening doesn’t just threaten the continent—it could wreak havoc on coastal cities , ecosystems, and weather systems worldwide.
Why Humanity Should Pay Attention Perhaps the most chilling realization from this research is that this chain reaction could become self-sustaining, even if human-driven greenhouse gas emissions were to stop. The processes already set in motion by ice melt and magma decompression have the potential to operate independently of human activity .
Scientists emphasize that while this process will unfold over centuries, its long-term consequences are unavoidable if current trends continue. The situation highlights the interconnectedness of Earth’s systems, where disruptions in one area—like ice melt—can trigger profound and unexpected changes elsewhere.
Looking To the Future Preventing this volcanic chain reaction may no longer be possible, but understanding it offers humanity a chance to prepare. Monitoring the Antarctic ice sheet and the underlying volcanic systems is now more critical than ever. Cutting-edge technologies, such as remote sensing, satellite imagery, and advanced simulations , could help predict future eruptions and mitigate their impacts.
The revelation of this hidden threat underscores an urgent truth: Antarctica is not just a passive victim of climate change but a potential amplifier of its most devastating effects .

author: archyde
title: Andrey Rublev: Health, Fitness, and Tennis Excellence in Dubai – Meet and Greet Event with MedCare and Aster Pharmacy
text:
2023-12-28 20:05:15
Dubai: After taking charge as the brand ambassador, tennis world number five Andrey Rublev attended a meet and greet event held at Jumeirah Med Care Medical Center. Andrey Rublev noted that as a professional athlete, he always prioritizes health, fitness and healthy living, and he appreciates Aster Pharmacy’s focus on providing good health and happiness by partnering with MedCare’s ‘Happiness Begins with Health’ campaign.
Reminiscing that sports are the best way to ward off lifestyle diseases, Rublev observed that superstars such as Novak Djokovic, Rafael Nadal and Roger Federer are examples for us all because they show excellence beyond their age by maintaining good health.
Along with his career, Andrei Rublev also finds time to help those around him. He could see many people suffering around him. Many children are affected by the difficulty as a teenager. That’s when I thought, when I become a good player, I can help these people, – he told reporters.
”Now seems like the time to do something. All I can do now. I continue that,” he said.
He hoped the relationship with Medcare and Aster Pharmacy would improve. Rublev made no fuss about missing Wimbledon after the All England Tennis Club banned Russian and Belarusian players over the Ukraine war just months after his Dubai victory. Instead, Rublev worked hard to play mixed doubles with Ukrainian players. It was solidarity with fellow professionals in Ukraine. He also shocked the world by sending the message ‘There is no war in tennis’. Our next generation must be better than us. Be kinder than ourselves. There are still many bad things going on in the world. He said that it is important to help every person and try to be a better person.
He remembers watching the iconic tennis match between Federer and Andre Agassi with bated breath in 2005 at the Burj Al Arab helipad, nearly 700 feet above ground level. He also observed that Dubai is one of the best places in the world where every tennis player prepares for the new season.
Rublev is also a tennis player who received a golden visa of the UAE. Winner of 14 ATP titles. Olympic mixed doubles gold medalist.
Meet and Greet Medcare CEO Dr. Shanila Laiju, Aster Retails CEO NS Balasubramanian and Chief Marketing Officer Rahul Kadavakolu were also present.
Comments in the comment box are not good morning. For readers only. Do not post obscene, defamatory, caste, religious or communal comments. Making such comments is punishable under the Central Government’s IT policy.
Related

author: Daniel Rainbird; The Canadian Press
title: Wiens, Zsombor-Murray: Canada's best men's diving Olympic medal hopes since Despatie
text:
MONTREAL — Canadian divers Rylan Wiens and Nathan Zsombor-Murray represent something the country hasn’t seen before, according to one of their coaches.
"We've never had the strong force of the Canadian team be two men on 10-metre,” coach Mary Carroll said Thursday from the Olympic Pool. “That's unheard of in Canadian diving.”
Wiens, a 22-year-old from Pike Lake, Sask., and the 20-year-old Zsombor-Murray of Pointe-Claire, Que., advanced to Saturday's men’s 10-metre platform final at the World Aquatics Diving World Cup on Thursday. Wiens finished seventh, while Zsombor-Murray placed ninth in the preliminaries.
At the Doha world championships earlier this month, the pair pre-qualified for this summer’s Paris Olympics in the 10-metre synchronized event.
Wiens also pre-qualified in the individual discipline after a fifth-place finish in Doha, while Zsombor-Murray, who placed ninth, will have to secure his spot at the Olympic trials in Windsor, Ont., from May 17-19.
Canada’s women have been a consistent presence on Olympic diving podiums. Meanwhile, the men haven't reached it since Alexandre Despatie won silver on the three-metre springboard at Beijing 2008.
Carroll believes Wiens and Zsombor-Murray have what it takes to buck that trend.
"If they're on, they have the quality to get a medal, and that's not just in synchro,” Carroll said. “That's what's special about the synchro team is we don't have one good diver and then a sidekick — we have two really good divers.
“They're hungry for two medals at the Olympics. That's their goal."
And both Wiens and Zsombor-Murray say they’re not shying away from the pressure that comes with being pegged as Canada's best chance to break a drought in men's diving.
"It just adds fuel to the fire," Wiens said. "We're more hungry than ever now that it's really shaping up this year."
The duo have already hit the podium on the international stage with a bronze medal in the 10-metre synchro at the 2022 worlds, a first in Canadian diving history.
But while trying to carry that momentum into 2023, Wiens hit several bumps in the road.
After hurting his neck and reaggravating it at last May’s World Cup stop in Montreal, he sustained a “pretty nasty” back injury in training and didn’t compete for five months.
Wiens says regaining his confidence was a long process after spending more time off the platform than he could ever remember.
“It was really tough at the start,” Wiens said. “On every dive, I was nervous, especially the one that I messed up and hadn't done for three months (a reverse two-and-a-half).”
At the worlds, both Wiens and Zsombor-Murray dealt with a sickness before their events.
Despite only training in two of five days in the lead up, Wiens rattled off six impressive dives in the individual final to score a 489.20 — just clearing the 480-point threshold to guarantee a ticket to Paris.
"The guy's physically tough, and Doha showed me once again how mentally tough he is,” added Carroll. “It's something to own going into the Olympic year because you need both."
While Wiens was on the sidelines in 2023, Zsombor-Murray dove to his best year yet with a 10-metre individual World Cup bronze in Montreal, two silvers at the PanAms and two national titles.
Although he fell short of individually qualifying for Paris at the worlds, Zsombor-Murray insists he’ll make good on the promise at the Olympic trials.
Zsombor-Murray and Wiens were 13th and 19th, respectively, in the individual 10-metre at the Tokyo Games in 2021. Come this summer, they’re aiming much higher.
“Now that the Games are coming up and I have the experience of the last Games behind me, I feel sort of more ferocious coming into the next Games,” Zsombor-Murray.
WARE ADVANCES
Canada’s Pamela Ware rebounded from a world championships to forget with a solid performance Thursday to advance to Saturday’s women’s three-metre springboard final.
The 31-year-old Ware, who won silver in Montreal last year, was coming off a disappointing 25th-place finish in Doha. She also missed her final dive in the three-metre synchro alongside partner Mia Vallee as Canada failed to secure a quota spot for this summer's Paris Olympics.
On Thursday, the Montreal native pulled off all her dives with consistency and placed sixth out of 17 in the preliminary round.
Calgary’s Aimee Wilson also moved on with a 12th-place finish while Amelie-Laura Jasmin, a 19-year-old from Montreal, placed 13th and missed the cut in her first-ever World Cup event.
Later Thursday, Benjamin Tessier of Blainville, Que., finished 17th in the men's 10-metre.
Men’s three-metre and women’s 10-metre preliminaries follow on Friday, along with a team event final.
The event features over 120 divers — including 12 Canadians — from more than 20 countries.
This report by The Canadian Press was first published Feb. 29, 2024.
Daniel Rainbird, The Canadian Press

author: Martín Manuel Díaz Rubio
title: En Cáceres (Antioquia) hay 445 familias afectadas a causa de la emergencia invernal
text:
En Cáceres (Antioquia) hay 445 familias afectadas a causa de la emergencia invernal
La Alcaldía de Cáceres realizó llamado urgente a toda la comunidad, a la prevención ante temporada de lluvias y crecientes del río Cauca.
Publicado: 7 de mayo de 2025, 5:48 PM
Actualizado: 7 de mayo de 2025, 5:48 PM
Inundaciones en Cáceres, Antioquia
Foto: Cortesía, Alcaldía de Cáceres
La Administración Municipal de Cáceres, informó que actualmente en ese municipio del Bajo Cauca antioqueño hay 445 familia afectadas a causa de la emergencia invernal que se presenta en el departamento.
De acuerdo con lo que señaló la alcaldesa de Cáceres Damina Monterrosa, hay afectaciones tanto en veredas, como cabecera municipal y en los propios corregimientos.
Le puede interesar:
Emergencia en Salgar: deslizamiento tapa el río San Juan y obliga a sobrevuelo urgente del Dagran
Agregó la mandataria Monterrosa, que las personas que más se están viendo afectadas son los agricultores, quienes tienen comprometidos los cultivos de pancoger, el sustento de ellos y de sus familias.
Por otra parte, sobre la posibilidad de declaratoria de emergencia pública para atender a los damnificados, la alcaldesa Damina Monterrosa, fue clara en indicar que se debe analizar la situación por la que atraviesan los municipios de la subregión y cómo el aumento del río se puede perjudicar a Cáceres.
En lo que tiene que ver con las ayudas humanitarias desde la Administración municipal, señalan que se tiene un rubro específico destinado para la atención de los damnificados: "si el río de aquí a mañana no disminuye, lo que significaría que sigan estas familias fuera de sus casas, les buscaremos albergues, y les entregaremos ayudas humanitarias. Tenemos más de mil ayudas para esta familias. Trabajo que venimos realizando con la Gobernación de Antioquia".
Le puede interesar:
Cinco de los once municipios del Urabá antioqueño están en emergencia invernal
Recientemente desde la Alcaldía en coordinación con el Consejo Municipal para la Gestión del Riesgo de Desastres (CMGRD), se realizó un llamado urgente a toda la comunidad de Cáceres con el objetivo de estar prevenidos y alertas sobre cualquier situación que se pueda producir con el aumento de la creciente y posible desbordamiento del río Cauca.
Fuente: Sistema Integrado de Información
Siga las noticias de RCN Radio en Whatsapp

author: SWP
title: Schulessen in BW: Zu viel Gemüse und Salat?
text:
Schulessen in BW: Zu viel Gemüse und Salat?
- BW-Gericht bestätigt: Kein Zwang zu Fleisch im Schulessen, Mehrheit bleibt vegetarisch/vegan.
- Eltern forderten täglich Fleisch/Fisch, wegen Gesundheitsbedenken; Antrag abgelehnt.
- VGH Mannheim wies Beschwerde zurück: Anwaltszwang nicht eingehalten.
- Tochter durfte nicht klagen, war nicht Teil des ersten Verfahrens.
- Beschluss unanfechtbar, kein Ernährungsmangel durch vegane/veg. Kost.
Die Zusammenfassung wurde durch künstliche Intelligenz erstellt.
Fleischgerichte werden an einer Schule im Raum Konstanz weiterhin die Ausnahme bleiben. Der Verwaltungsgerichtshof Baden-Württemberg (VGH) in Mannheim hat Beschwerden zum überwiegend vegetarischen Schulessen als unzulässig zurückgewiesen, wie der VGH am Donnerstag mitteilte. Der Beschluss sei unanfechtbar (AZ: 9 S 1044/25).
Eltern hatten sich daran gestört, dass das Schulessen, das von Montag bis Donnerstag angeboten wird, an drei Tagen aus vegetarischer oder veganer Kost besteht. Nur an einem Tag werde ein Fleisch- oder Fischangebot bereitgehalten.
Die Eltern hatten bereits mit einem Eilantrag (2 K 1477/25) beim Verwaltungsgericht Freiburg erreichen wollen, dass ihrer Tochter an allen Tagen ein Schulessen mit Fleisch oder Fisch zur Verfügung gestellt wird. Sie trugen unter anderem gesundheitliche Bedenken vor. Das Verwaltungsgericht hatte den Antrag zurückgewiesen. Es sei fernliegend, dass ein Ernährungsmangel drohe.
Der VGH wies die Beschwerde der Eltern nun als unzulässig zurück, da die Eltern Beschwerde ohne Rechtsanwalt erhoben haben. Dabei bestehe vor dem VGH ein sogenannter „Anwaltszwang“. Die Beschwerde der Tochter sei ebenfalls unzulässig. „Sie war nicht Beteiligte im erstinstanzlichen Verfahren und deswegen nicht befugt eine Beschwerde zu erheben“, heißt es in der Mitteilung.

author: feedtrade.com.cn
title: CBOT收盘：玉米期货收低，因美国中西部种植天气有利-饲料行业信息网CBOT收盘：玉米期货收低，因美国中西部种植天气有利-饲料行业信息网-
text:
北京时间2025年5月8日，美国时间7日，CBOT玉米收盘449.2 跌6.2 或 跌幅6.2% 参考详细信息：
　　5月7日(周三)，芝加哥期货交易所(CBOT)玉米期货收低，尽管对美国玉米的需求良好，但美国中西部种植天气有利，且巴西即将收割，令价格承压。
　　CBOT交投最活跃的7月玉米合约收跌6-1/4美分，结算价报每蒲式耳4.49-1/4美元。
　　12月玉米期货收低1/2美分，报每蒲式耳4.40-3/4美元。
　　根据Commodity Weather Group的数据，未来10天美国中西部地区的有利天气预计将提供播种机会。预计好天气将允许农民播种玉米作物，预期将丰收。
　　一项大宗商品研究报告显示，温和的天气条件和稳定的播种进度预计推动2025/26年度美国玉米产量提高1%，达到3.98亿吨，预估区间为3.79-4.17亿吨。目前种植面积预估为9430万英亩，较上一年度增长4.1%，较美国农业部3月份种植意向报告(3月31日)中预估的9530万英亩低100万英亩。调查(3月25日)显示，美国玉米种植面积为9440万英亩。美国农业部下一次基于调查的种植面积预估将在6月30日的种植面积报告中公布。
　　巴西对外贸易秘书处(Secex)公布的出口数据显示，巴西4月出口玉米178,347.53吨，日均出口量为8,917.38吨，较上年4月全月的日均出口量3,006.33吨增加197%。
　　一项大宗商品研究报告显示，巴西中西部、南部和东南部的二茬玉米作物核心区土壤墒情改善，植被密度高，预计推动2024/25年度巴西玉米总产量略增至1.253亿吨，预估区间为1.221–1.284亿吨，尽管短期天气展望不甚有利。
